highlights.text: Adult members may receive up to $1,000 in dental benefits per year (July 1 through June 30.) Emergency and denture benefits are not subject to this limit.
highlights.html:
Adult members may receive up to $1,000 in dental benefits per year (July 1 through June

  • 30.) Emergency and denture benefits are not subject to this limit.

highlights.text: 2.04 HCBS DIDD Adult Waiver Dental Benefit Limits - DD and SLS Wavier Program
highlights.html: 2.04 HCBS DIDD Adult Waiver Dental Benefit Limits - DD and SLS Wavier Program

highlights.text: In addition to the State Plan adult benefit, adult waiver participant members age 21 and over may receive up to $2,000 in basic/preventative dental benefits per individualized Service Plan year.
highlights.html: In addition to the State Plan adult benefit, adult waiver participant members age 21 and over may receive up to $2,000 in basic/preventative dental benefits per individualized Service Plan year.

highlights.text: DIDD adult waiver participant members may also receive up to $10,000 in major dental benefits over the 5 year lifespan of the Waivers (July 1, 2014-June 30, 2019)
highlights.html: DIDD adult waiver participant members may also receive up to $10,000 in major dental benefits over the 5 year lifespan of the Waivers (July 1, 2014-June 30, 2019)

highlights.text: State Plan Limits for DIDD Adult Waiver Participant Members • $1,000 benefit limit per Fiscal Year (July 1- June 30) • Same benefit as general Health First Colorado population (please reference Appendix B, Exhibit B)
highlights.html:
State Plan Limits for DIDD Adult Waiver Participant Members

  • • $1,000 benefit limit per Fiscal Year (July 1- June 30)
  • • Same benefit as general Health First Colorado population (please reference Appendix B, Exhibit B)

highlights.text: Dental services for adults 21 years of age and older are limited to a total of $1,000 per adult Health First Colorado recipient per year (July 1 - June 30). Emergency and denture benefits are not subject to this limit.
highlights.html: Dental services for adults 21 years of age and older are limited to a total of $1,000 per adult Health First Colorado recipient per year (July 1 - June 30). Emergency and denture benefits are not subject to this limit.

highlights.text: DD Waiver Program Limits for DIDD Adult Waiver Participant Members • $2,000 basic/preventative benefit per service plan year (varies per individual Service Plan year)

DD Waiver Program Limits for DIDD Adult Waiver Participant Members

highlights.text: Complete dentures and partial dentures shall only be provided once every 84 months (7 years) for adult members and are not subject to the $1,000 per adult member annual maximum.
highlights.html: Complete dentures and partial dentures shall only be provided once every 84 months (7 years) for adult members and are not subject to the $1,000 per adult member annual maximum.

highlights.text: Dental prophylaxis (i.e., teeth cleanings) is recommended every 6 months, and may be reimbursed twice per 12 months per member.
highlights.html: Dental prophylaxis (i.e., teeth cleanings) is recommended every 6 months, and may be reimbursed twice per 12 months per member.

highlights.text: Members determined to be at high risk for periodontal disease or high risk for caries (decay) is eligible for additional services. These services include up to four (4) prophylaxis procedures without a history of periodontal disease or up to four (4) periodontal maintenance procedures once a history of periodontal disease is established, per year.
highlights.html: Members determined to be at high risk for periodontal disease or high risk for caries (decay) is eligible for additional services. These services include up to four (4) prophylaxis procedures without a history of periodontal disease or up to four (4) periodontal maintenance procedures once a history of periodontal disease is established, per year.

highlights.text: Members who are determined to fit into the high risk category for periodontal disease or high risk for caries (decay) are eligible for any combination of up to four (4) prophylaxes or up to four (4) periodontal maintenance visits per year.
highlights.html: Members who are determined to fit into the high risk category for periodontal disease or high risk for caries (decay) are eligible for any combination of up to four (4) prophylaxes or up to four (4) periodontal maintenance visits per year.

values.label: d1206 - topical fluoride varnish; therapeutic application for moderate to high caries risk patients

highlights.text: Topical fluoride is a covered benefit for child members through age 20 and topical fluoride treatments are allowed twice (2) per year for child members.
highlights.html: Topical fluoride is a covered benefit for child members through age 20 and topical fluoride treatments are allowed twice (2) per year for child members.

values.label: d1206 - topical fluoride varnish; therapeutic application for moderate to high caries risk patients

highlights.text: Fluoride varnish is considered the standard of care and is the only acceptable topical fluoride treatment for child member's ages 0 through 5 years (up to the day before their sixth birthday).
highlights.html: Fluoride varnish is considered the standard of care and is the only acceptable topical fluoride treatment for child member's ages 0 through 5 years (up to the day before their sixth birthday).

highlights.text: Fluoride rinse is not an acceptable treatment for any child member and will not be reimbursed.
highlights.html: Fluoride rinse is not an acceptable treatment for any child member and will not be reimbursed.

highlights.html: DD Waiver Program Limits for DIDD Adult Waiver Participant Members

highlights.text: • $10,000 major benefit per life time of waiver (July 1, 2014- June 30, 2019)
highlights.html: • $10,000 major benefit per life time of waiver (July 1, 2014- June 30, 2019)

highlights.text: Prophylaxis is not a benefit when billed on the same date of service as any periodontal procedure code.

highlights.text: Members determined to be at high risk for periodontal disease or high risk for caries (decay) is eligible for additional services. These services include up to four (4) prophylaxis procedures without a history of periodontal disease or up to four (4) periodontal maintenance procedures once a history of periodontal disease is established, per year.

values.label: d1206 - topical fluoride varnish; therapeutic application for moderate to high caries risk patients

highlights.text: Child members ages 0 through 4 years at high risk for caries may receive an additional two (2) fluoride topical applications per year for a total of up to four (4) per year.
highlights.html: Child members ages 0 through 4 years at high risk for caries may receive an additional two (2) fluoride topical applications per year for a total of up to four (4) per year.

highlights.text: Topical fluoride is a covered benefit for child members through age 20
highlights.html: Topical fluoride is a covered benefit for child members through age 20

highlights.text: Child members ages 5 through 20 years may receive an additional one (1) per year with no adjustment for risk for a total of three (3) per year.
highlights.html: Child members ages 5 through 20 years may receive an additional one (1) per year with no adjustment for risk for a total of three (3) per year.

highlights.text: However, either topical fluoride or fluoride varnish may be used for child members after the child's sixth birthday.
highlights.html: However, either topical fluoride or fluoride varnish may be used for child members after the child's sixth birthday.

highlights.text: Prior authorization (PAR) is not necessary for adult members to receive topical fluoride treatments.
highlights.html: Prior authorization (PAR) is not necessary for adult members to receive topical fluoride treatments.

highlights.text: Criteria for Space Maintainers
highlights.html: Criteria for Space Maintainers

highlights.text: • Removable and fixed space maintainers are performed to prevent tooth movement and maintain the space for eruption of a first or second premolar or permanent first molar when a primary tooth has been lost prematurely or for a congenitally missing permanent tooth for members up to the age of 14.
highlights.html: • Removable and fixed space maintainers are performed to prevent tooth movement and maintain the space for eruption of a first or second premolar or permanent first molar when a primary tooth has been lost prematurely or for a congenitally missing permanent tooth for members up to the age of 14.

highlights.text: Criteria for Space Maintainers
highlights.html: Criteria for Space Maintainers

highlights.text: • The procedure is reimbursable twice per quadrant per lifetime and includes any follow-up care and/or re-cementing, if necessary.
highlights.html: • The procedure is reimbursable twice per quadrant per lifetime and includes any follow-up care and/or re-cementing, if necessary.

highlights.html: Criteria for Space Maintainers

values.label: d2933 - prefabricated stainless steel crown with resin window

highlights.text: Prefabricated stainless steel crowns, prefabricated resin crowns, and prefabricated stainless steel crowns with a resin window are a benefit for both primary and permanent teeth for child and adult members.
highlights.html: Prefabricated stainless steel crowns, prefabricated resin crowns, and prefabricated stainless steel crowns with a resin window are a benefit for both primary and permanent teeth for child and adult members.

highlights.text: Members with a history of periodontal treatment, including scaling and root planing and osseous surgery will be eligible for up to four (4) periodontal maintenance visits per year.
highlights.html: Members with a history of periodontal treatment, including scaling and root planing and osseous surgery will be eligible for up to four (4) periodontal maintenance visits per year.

highlights.text: Members determined to be at high risk for periodontal disease or high risk for caries (decay) is eligible for additional services. These services include up to four (4) Prophylaxis procedures without a history of periodontal disease or up to four (4) Periodontal Maintenance procedures once a history of periodontal disease is established, per year. Any services exceeding these guidelines will be subject to utilization management (UM) review.

values.label: d4341 - periodontal scaling and root planing - four or more teeth per quadrant
d4342 - periodontal scaling and root planing - one to three teeth per quadrant

highlights.text: Covered Procedures (child and adult members) • Periodontal scaling and root planing - four (4) or more teeth affected in the quadrant (D4341) • Periodontal scaling and root planing - one (1) to three (3) teeth affected in the quadrant (D4342).
highlights.html:
• Covered Procedures (child and adult members)

  • • Periodontal scaling and root planing - four (4) or more teeth affected in the quadrant (D4341)
  • • Periodontal scaling and root planing - one (1) to three (3) teeth affected in the quadrant (D4342).

highlights.text: • Periodontal scaling and root planing (D4341 and/or D4342) is allowed once per quadrant every three (3) years (children and adults).
highlights.html: • Periodontal scaling and root planing (D4341 and/or D4342) is allowed once per quadrant every three (3) years (children and adults).
